snippet: The jury’s decision for Bruce Bent is the latest blow to S.E.C. efforts to hold individuals responsible for the risk-taking that led to the 2008 financial crisis.
abstract: Federal jury in Manhattan rejects Securities and Exchange Commission claim that Bruce Bent, credited with inventing popular investment vehicle known as a money market fund, and son Bruce Bent II, defrauded investors when his flagship Reserve Primary Fund failed in September 2008; decision is latest blow to SEC efforts to hold individuals responsible for the risk-taking that led to the 2008 financial crisis.

byline.original: By NATHANIEL POPPER and JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG

lead_paragraph: The jury’s decision for Bruce Bent is the latest blow to S.E.C. efforts to hold individuals responsible for the risk-taking that led to the 2008 financial crisis.

headline.seo: Bruce Bent Sr. and Son Cleared of Fraud Charges
headline.main: Money-Market Pioneer and Son Cleared of Fraud
headline.print_headline: Mixed Verdict on Fraud at a Money Market Mutual Fund
